{"blocks":[{"key":"cvsc0","text":"Add a little excess water to the groove of the diamond sectioning knife to make it convex and stop when the full length of the diamond blade is soaked.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3p2k5","text":"Gently draw a portion of the water under the microscope with a syringe or Pasteur pipette. {"blocks":[{"key":"dl1ts","text":"Adjust the knife angle so that the two parallel sides of the trapezoid sample are parallel to the blade.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8b7kt","text":"Raise the block until it stops slightly above the knife blade.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
